title: U-M gets major fine, add to Moore suspension
content: The NCAA's Committee on Infractions ruled on Michigan's advanced scouting case Friday with the school getting a significant fine including the loss of two years of postseason football revenue but avoiding punitive penalties such as a postseason ban.

title: Commanders need McLaurin on field, OC says
content: The Commanders' offense hasn't looked sharp for much of the summer, but offensive coordinator Kliff Kingsbury knows why: Too many players are missing, starting with wide receiver Terry McLaurin.

title: Survey: NFL vets report high toll, few regrets
content: Former NFL players now entering retirement age are more likely to be living with chronic pain or a disability than the average American man, but the vast majority would opt to play football again, a new survey has found.

title: Rebels' Golding among top-paid DCs with new deal
content: Ole Miss defensive coordinator Pete Golding has signed a new three-year contract extension that places him among the top four highest-paid defensive coordinators in college football.

title: Sources: NFLPA puts one of top lawyers on leave
content: The NFL Players Association put Heather McPhee, whose allegations helped prompt a federal investigation, on paid administrative leave after multiple employees filed complaints with the union's human resources department, sources said.

title: Bond won't be charged, says he's joining Browns
content: The sexual assault case against former Texas wide receiver Isaiah Bond has been no-billed and he faces no further criminal charges, Collin County (Texas) District Attorney Greg Willis said.

title: Hello again: Durant, Davis returns mark NBA slate
content: The Rockets' Kevin Durant will make his return to Phoenix on Nov. 24, while the Mavericks' Anthony Davis will return to Los Angeles to play the Lakers on Nov. 28.

title: First-place Phillies to use 6 SPs with Nola return
content: Phillies manager Rob Thomson says he will use a six-man rotation beginning this weekend when Aaron Nola returns from the injured list.

title: Packers' Love: Surgery now so 100% for Week 1
content: Packers quarterback Jordan Love opted to have surgery on his left thumb this week because he didn't want to go into the season with any nagging injuries.

title: Mets, Mariners players as Little Leaguers
content: From Cal Raleigh to Juan Soto, here's what players in this year's Little League Classic looked like as Little Leaguers themselves.

title: Stacking the best, worst positional groups in the NFL: 1-32 rankings, plus roster outlooks
content: Which team has the best wide receivers? The shakiest edge rusher room? We ranked all 32 teams in 10 position groups.

title: Every matchup from the Celebration Bowl to the national title game
content: It's August and no games have been played, but we're breaking down who will be where in December and beyond.

title: What do NFL scouts think of Arch Manning and what can Texas expect from him this fall?
content: Manning now has the reins of the Longhorns' offense, but what do evaluators think of him entering the season -- and when could he enter the NFL draft?

title: Dive into the ESPN/KFF Survey of 1988 NFL Players
content: Read the key takeaways and methodology of the ESPN/KFF Survey of 1988 NFL Players, and see additional stories and videos from the project.

title: Is Flagg a ROY lock? How 11 rookies can challenge the No. 1 pick
content: NBA analyst Kevin Pelton groups 11 players most likely to threaten the Mavericks' No. 1 pick for the auspicious award.

title: USMNT countdown to the World Cup: Sargent making early claim to be Pochettino's No. 9
content: The European club season is upon us, which is a great time to start monitoring the U.S. player pool ahead of the men's World Cup. In a new weekly feature, we'll assess their progress on the road to next summer.

title: Tory Horton, Jaxson Dart, Adonai Mitchell among deep sleepers for 2025
content: These sleepers are truly for those in deeper leagues seeking off-the-radar types who might emerge in 2025.

title: A White House nod boosts the stature of once-shunned MMA
content: Dana White recounts sport's long journey from 'human cockfighting' obscurity to a presidential embrace

title: Awards tracker: Collier, Bueckers dominate MVP, ROY talk; other races less set
content: Napheesa Collier and Paige Bueckers will be hard to catch while the other player awards have changed front-runners in August.

title: 10 biggest WNBA games that will determine the 2025 playoff race
content: From a Lynx-Liberty showdown to the regular-season finale, these are the most impactful WNBA games left.

title: The Bottom 10 is back! Who will bring up the rear in college football in 2025?
content: If you want national title contenders, look somewhere else. Here, Ryan McGee salutes the best of the worst.

title: 11 second-year players who could break out this season
content: These super sophomores could make a significant impact, including on the College Football Playoff race.

title: Top moments from Azzi Fudd and Paige Bueckers on 'Close Friends Only' podcast
content: The star women's basketball pairing dished on when they realized they'd connect, who their favorite WNBA player is and more.

title: The NBA schedule is out! Here are the best games -- and beefs -- to watch this season
content: Following the NBA's schedule release, our insiders break down which 2025-26 games have the most intrigue.

title: Premier League returns: Predicting the table, asking the big questions and tracking transfers
content: The Premier League's back! Let's predict how each team will finish by assessing how Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, Man United and all the rest look.

title: Week 1 predicted starting XIs: Liverpool, Arsenal, Man City, more
content: After a busy summer of transfers and preseason prep, here's how we expect all the top clubs to line up.

title: 'Last year was abnormal': How Patrick Mahomes raised his game another level for 2025
content: After a crushing Super Bowl LIX loss, Mahomes has wowed teammates and coaches with his accuracy and focus this summer.

title: What to know about the 2025 PFL lightweight, bantamweight and women's flyweight finals
content: The PFL World Championships finals continue Friday with Gadzhi Rabadanov vs. Alfie Davis and  Liz Carmouche vs. Jena Bishop.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United ready to move for Hjulmand
content: Manchester United have an offer prepared for Sporting CP midfielder Morten Hjulmand. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: MVP: Who we like, who offers value ahead of the season
content: It's no surprise that QBs dominate the favorites. But who offers the most value, and is there a sleeper pick among them? Here are our best bets.

title: The Alaska agenda: Trump-Putin's high-stakes meeting in a few hours - what to expect?
content: In Alaska, US President Trump and Russian President Putin will meet to discuss the Ukraine war, despite Ukraine's exclusion. Trump hopes for a breakthrough, hinting at territorial swaps, while Putin seeks to block Ukraine's Nato bid. The summit risks upsetting allies and validating Russia, with potential talks covering security guarantees and sanctions.

title: Historic! 21-yo Bethell on brink of 136-year-old England cricket record
content: Jacob Bethell, the 21-year-old all-rounder, is set to become England's youngest-ever men's cricket captain, breaking a 136-year-old record. He will lead the team against Ireland in three Twenty20s in Dublin next month. England men's selector Luke Wright stated that Bethell's leadership qualities have impressed since joining the England squads, and this series will further develop his skills.

title: Apple founder Steve Jobs lived by the rule that God is in …
content: Steve Jobs, the Apple founder, was a firm believer in the philosophy that "God is in the details," shaping Apple's DNA through meticulous attention to even the smallest design elements. His relentless pursuit of perfection, extending to hidden components, pushed teams to innovate and create exceptional products.

title: 'Honestly': Hillary says she would nominate Trump for Nobel; but sets condition
content: Hillary Clinton stated she would nominate Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize if he brokers a Russia-Ukraine peace deal that prevents Ukraine from losing territory. This statement precedes Trump's meeting with Vladimir Putin in Alaska, where Trump aims to find a resolution to the conflict. Zelenskyy has urged Trump to convince Russia to end the war.

title: MS Dhoni, Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma — India's rare all-format captains
content: In 2025, Indian cricket sees Shubman Gill taking over Test captaincy from Rohit Sharma, who retired from the format but continues to lead in ODIs. Suryakumar Yadav is now the T20I captain. Previously, MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli held all-format captaincy.

title: Demography, swadeshi push & stern warning to Pak: 10 takeaways from PM Modi’s speech
content: In his Independence Day address, PM Modi highlighted India's progress and future goals. He lauded Operation Sindoor, warned against terrorism and demographic changes, and emphasised self-reliance in space. Modi also praised the RSS's contributions and cautioned against repeating the Emergency's mistakes. He addressed farmers' interests amid tariff disputes and advocated for 'Swadeshi' products, urging national unity and development.

title: USA needs Intel: Ex-Intel CEO suggests $40 billion plan
content: Craig Barrett, ex-Intel CEO, suggests a $40 billion rescue plan. He urges major customers like Nvidia and Apple to invest. This aims to secure America's chip manufacturing future. Barrett criticizes current leadership's investment approach. He proposes tariffs on chip imports. President Trump seems to soften his stance on Intel's CEO after a meeting.

title: Watch: Duplantis gets cold reply from Lyles over viral shove - ‘That was kinda crazy’
content: Mondo Duplantis playfully questioned Noah Lyles about his post-race incident with Kenny Bednarek, eliciting a "no comment" response. Lyles then jokingly requested Duplantis not to set a new world record. The upcoming 100-meter race is highly anticipated, featuring Lyles and Kishane Thompson, promising a near-replica of the Olympic final with top contenders.

title: More tariff to come: Trump signals levies on chips and steel; duties may hit 300%
content: President Trump is planning new tariffs on semiconductor chips and steel, potentially shaking global trade. The rates will start low to encourage domestic manufacturing before increasing significantly. Trump hinted at tariffs as high as 100% or even more on semiconductors, with exemptions for companies building in the U.S.

title: Jamie Dimon on US-China tech race: Calls reliance on China ‘embarrassing’
content: The Nvidia H20 chip sales to China are under scrutiny. This has intensified the US-China tech rivalry. Jamie Dimon warns about US vulnerability. He points out dependence on China for essential goods. Chinese regulators question Nvidia chip purchases. They are pushing for domestic alternatives. Nvidia denies security risks. China is asking tech firms to reconsider Nvidia orders.

title: Neeraj’s wife Himani rejects Rs 1.5 crore job offer; her father reveals why
content: Himani Mor, Neeraj Chopra's wife, transitions from professional tennis to sports business, declining a lucrative US job offer to pursue her own venture. Currently in Europe with Neeraj during his training, Himani holds a degree in Political Science and Sports Management. Neeraj, meanwhile, withdrew from the Silesia Diamond League, focusing on the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title: Nagaland governor passes away: La Ganesan dies at 80; PM Modi offers condolences
content: Nagaland Governor La Ganesan passed away at the age of 80 in a Chennai hospital while undergoing treatment. He had been in the ICU after collapsing at his home and sustaining a head injury on August 8. Appointed in February 2023, Ganesan's death prompted condolences from PM Modi, who remembered him as a dedicated nationalist and BJP leader.

title: Pakistan monsoon fury: Helicopter crashes during rescue mission; 5 dead
content: A Khyber Pakhtunkhwa government helicopter crashed in Pakistan's Mohmand district due to severe weather while carrying relief goods to rain-affected areas of Bajaur, resulting in the tragic death of all five crew members. The MI-17 helicopter lost contact en route from Peshawar, prompting a rescue operation.

title: 'Indeed, high stakes': Zelenskyy reacts to Trump-Putin Alaska meet; 'counting on America'
content: As Trump and Putin meet in Alaska, Zelenskyy emphasizes the high stakes for Ukraine, seeking a path to just peace through trilateral discussions. He reported battlefield updates and intelligence assessments, stressing Russia's losses and intentions. Trump indicated potential security guarantees for Ukraine but left land concessions to their discretion, aiming for a deal-making second meeting.

title: Alaska summit: Russian foreign minister 'trolls' Trump; wears 'USSR' sweatshirt
content: Sergei Lavrov's choice of attire, a USSR sweatshirt, sparked controversy upon his arrival in Alaska for talks between Putin and Trump. Critics viewed the garment as a provocative symbol of Russian imperial ambitions, especially given Alaska's history as a former Russian territory. Former Lithuanian foreign minister Gabrielius Landsbergis quipped on X about Lavrov’s clothing choice: “‘Just give us half of Ukraine and we promise we will stop,’ says negotiator wearing USSR sweatshirt.”

title: 'Retirement le lu?’: Rohit Sharma asks Rishabh Pant directly - WATCH
content: India clinched the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, defeating New Zealand in a thrilling final under Rohit Sharma's captaincy. Rishabh Pant's video captured the team's jubilant celebrations, including a playful exchange with Rohit about his retirement plans. Both Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are set to make their ODI comeback in the series against Australia in October.

title: Exclusive | Parents' sleepless nights, coding, and chess: India gets 89th GM in Rohith
content: Rohith Krishna S, a 19-year-old from Chennai, has become India's 89th Grandmaster, achieving his final GM norm at the Almaty Region Open. His journey, fueled by family support and sacrifices, involved countless hours of practice and international tournaments. Rohith now balances chess with his computer science studies, setting his sights on a 2600 rating and ultimately, the world championship.

title: GST rates to come down! 99% of items in 12% bracket may move to 5%
content: The Centre's proposed GST revamp is set to significantly alter tax slabs, with approximately 90% of items from the 28% bracket potentially moving to 18%. Furthermore, about 99% of goods currently in the 12% slab could be shifted to the 5% bracket.

title: I-Day in Melbourne disrupted: Indians come face to face with Khalistan 'goons' - video
content: Independence Day celebrations at the Indian consulate in Melbourne faced disruption from Khalistani protesters, but attendees countered with patriotic songs. The consul general hoisted the flag amidst calls to strengthen India-Australia ties. This incident follows other Khalistani-linked activities in Australian cities, including temple vandalism and attacks on Indian students, raising concerns and prompting monitoring by local authorities.

title: Travis Kelce makes history: Taylor Swift stuns fans; New Heights podcast explodes
content: Pop star Taylor Swift made a surprise appearance on the 'New Heights' podcast with Travis and Jason Kelce. The episode became the most-watched in the podcast's history within 12 hours. Swift shared details about how her relationship with Travis Kelce began. Kelce had previously mentioned wanting to meet her on the podcast. They officially met on July 8, 2023.

title: Fighter jets to Rs 1L cr youth employment push - 10 key announcements by PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi addressed the nation on Independence Day, outlining initiatives for energy independence, domestic semiconductor production, and GST reforms. He introduced the PM Viksit Bharat Rojgar Yojana to boost job creation and emphasized prioritizing farmers' interests. Modi also warned against nuclear threats and criticized the Indus Waters Treaty, vowing to protect India's interests.

title: Independence Day: Rahul, Kharge absent from Red Fort event; BJP questions no-show
content: The BJP criticized Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge for not attending the Independence Day celebration at the Red Fort. Amit Malviya, BJP I-T cell chief, questioned Gandhi's absence and commitment to national events, also noting his disoriented appearance at the Congress HQ. He further emphasized that such absence sends a poor message about his commitment to national occasions.

title: Pakistan rains: Nearly 200 dead in 24 hours; over 320 killed since ‘unusual’ downpours began
content: Monsoon rains in Pakistan have caused widespread devastation, claiming at least 117 lives in the last 24 hours alone. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province is the worst hit, with flash floods sweeping away homes and leaving many stranded. The meteorological department has issued warnings for further heavy rainfall.

title: Mahindra unveils 4 new concept SUVs, launch timeline revealed: Details
content: Mahindra & Mahindra unveiled its future SUV strategy, showcasing the NU_IQ platform and four concept vehicles as part of its Vision 2027 plan. Production models based on the NU_IQ platform, designed for versatile powertrain options and enhanced interior space, are expected to launch in 2027.

title: ICC slaps five-year ban on ex-cricketer for match fixing
content: Saliya Saman, a former Sri Lankan cricketer, has been banned from all cricket for five years after being found guilty of breaching the ECB Anti-Corruption Code. The charges relate to attempts to corrupt matches in the 2021 Abu Dhabi T10 Cricket League. Saman was found guilty on three counts, including attempting to fix matches and offering rewards for corrupt conduct.

title: Trump tariff impact: India faces hard choices, says GTRI; warns of $50 bn export hit
content: India faces a strategic dilemma as the US imposes a 50% tariff on most Indian goods, potentially costing India $50 billion. Options include negotiation, retaliation, export diversification, or offering concessions like halting Russian oil imports. Bilateral trade talks continue despite the dispute, with aims to significantly increase trade by 2030.

title: MS Dhoni's seven-word message: 'Consider me as retired'
content: Five years ago, MS Dhoni, India's celebrated captain and wicketkeeper, retired from international cricket, marking the end of an era. His leadership led India to victories in the T20 World Cup (2007), the ODI World Cup (2011), and the Champions Trophy (2013), making him the only captain to win all three major ICC white-ball trophies.

title: Dwyane Wade & Gabrielle Union: Cozy time with pup Trey
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union shared heartwarming moments with their French bulldog, Trey, on social media, showcasing their love for their pet. Despite Union's humorous aversion to Trey in the bedroom, as revealed in a playful debate, the couple's affection for their dog is evident. Wade's bond with Trey is strong, as highlighted by beach outings and emotional bonding.

title: ‘Senior terrorist eliminated’: IDF says Hamas military control dept head killed
content: The IDF announced the killing of Nasser Moussa, a senior Hamas figure, in an airstrike in southern Gaza. Moussa, responsible for training and operations, was a close associate of a previously eliminated commander. The IDF also targeted rocket storage sites. Amid ongoing military actions, a deepening humanitarian crisis unfolds in Gaza, with rising casualties and accusations of restricted aid.

title: 'Glorifying RSS an insult to freedom struggle': Owaisi criticises PM Modi's speech
content: Asaduddin Owaisi has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for praising the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) during his Independence Day speech. Owaisi described Modi's glorification of the RSS as an insult to the freedom struggle, accusing the organization of not participating in the independence movement and opposing Mahatma Gandhi.

title: ‘Rs 15,000 in 1st pvt job': PM Modi unveils Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana; what the scheme offers
content: Prime Minister Modi introduced the PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana on Independence Day, effective from August 1, 2025. This initiative aims to generate 3.5 crore jobs in two years, with a focus on first-time job seekers. The scheme provides incentives for both employees and employers to boost hiring and economic growth, with a substantial budget allocated for its implementation.

title: 'Your country enjoys well-deserved respect': Putin wishes PM Modi on I-Day
content: On India's Independence Day, Russia extended warm greetings to President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, acknowledging India's significant achievements across various sectors. Vladimir Putin emphasized the strategic partnership between the two nations and expressed eagerness to broaden bilateral cooperation. This message arrives amidst US tariff threats and geopolitical tensions, highlighting the enduring bond between Russia and India.

title: ‘Biggest NGO in the world’: PM Modi hails RSS in I-Day speech
content: On the 79th Independence Day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) from the Red Fort, acknowledging its century of service to the nation. He hailed the RSS as the world's largest NGO, emphasizing its dedication to nation-building and welfare.

title: Watch: 2 BJP MLAs clash inside UP assembly; Akhilesh shares viral video
content: A video capturing a heated argument between BJP lawmakers Rajesh Chaudhary and Saurabh Srivastava during the Uttar Pradesh assembly's monsoon session has gone viral. The clash erupted when Chaudhary, representing Mathura, was denied his allocated speaking time due to extended speeches by others. Srivastava, acting as chief whip, engaged in a verbal exchange with Chaudhary, prompting intervention from other members.

title: Six killed as vehicle jumps divider and hits truck in Chhattisgarh
content: The victims were travelling from Indore to Puri via Chhattisgarh when the vehicle they were in hit a road divider and vaulted over it to collide with a truck coming from the opposite direction

title: Supreme Court Collegium cannot dictate names to High Court Collegiums: CJI Gavai
content: Chief Justice says in a federal judiciary, the Supreme Court and the State High Courts are neither superior nor inferior to each other, and the relationship is that of mutual respect

title: Watch: Why is an Assamese group not celebrating Independence Day?
content: The United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA) has once again made headlines after its Independent faction (ULFA-I) announced a boycott of India’s Independence Day

title: Stree Shakti will foster women’s financial independence, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Launching free bus travel scheme for women, CM calls it a brother’s gift to his sisters across the State on  Independence Day; says the facility is being provided in 8,458 (74%) buses of APSRTC

title: J.C. Road braces for gridlock as BBMP set to begin milling works
content: The 1.3-km route from Minerva Circle to Town Hall Junction, normally covered in six to ten minutes depending on congestion on connecting roads, now takes at least 15 minutes for two-wheelers and 20 minutes for other vehicles

title: Palaniswami raises doubts over ‘Thayumanavar’ programme
content: Which vehicles do you intend to move the ration goods with? There are reports that private vehicles are used. How will pay for these vehicles, asks the AIADMK general secretary

title: Stray dog menace spirals in Thrissur as attacks rise and control efforts stall
content: Over 29,000 dog bite cases reported in 2024; public opposition derails new Animal Birth Control centres

title: 10-year-old boy dead, 9 injured in blast caused by gas leak in Bengaluru
content: The deceased Mubarak’s eight-year-old sister, Fathima, is serious and is being treated in a  hospital.

title: For Chengara land struggle families of Pullur-Periye, freedom still feels far away
content: 85 families, including Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and other communities, shifted to the hilly terrain 15 years ago after participating in the Chengara land struggle.  Beneficiaries say there have been deceived, allotted barren laterite plots, making farming and dignified living impossible

title: Special drive to sensitise passengers on need to travel with valid tickets
content: Drive will focus on originating stations of the most crowded trains, where ticket checking teams will ensure that only passengers with valid tickets are allowed to board

title: Centre proposes fewer GST rates: only 5% & 18% to remain, tax on common-use items slashed
content: This would entail entirely doing away with the 12% and 28% tax brackets; daily-use items such as toothpaste, soap, and shampoo could see their tax rates slashed; PM says the new reforms are part of Centre’s Deepavali gift

title: Andhra Pradesh targets 15% growth, poverty-free State under ‘Swarna Andhra 2047’: Minister
content: At I-Day celebrations, Nadendla Manohar outlines P4 programme’s anti-poverty push, welfare schemes, major investments, and infrastructure projects

title: ADGP Ajith Kumar blames political vendetta, police discord and anti-national interests for graft case against him
content: After a special court here rebuffed the VACB preliminary enquiry report exonerating the high-ranking officer from any wrongdoing, the police officer claims charges against him were politically motivated, fuelled by anti-national elements.

title: Defend Assamese identity, says Assam CM in I-Day speech
content: Barring a petrol bomb hurled at a police vehicle in Shillong, the 79th Independence Day was celebrated across the Northeast despite a boycott call by extremist groups

title: TDP, JSP leaders recall freedom fighters’ vision, stress need to uphold democratic values
content: On 79th Independence Day, leaders call for governance rooted in equality, self-respect and constitutional ideals

title: Before Sepoy Mutiny, the palegars of Chitradurga attempted a rebellion against the British
content: The chieftains, confined in Bengaluru, made an escape and tried to organise a rebellion in 1849 around Dodderi

title: Fulfil freedom fighters’ dreams, Minister urges people
content: At Eluru’s 79th Independence Day celebrations, Kolusu Parthasarathy launches a free bus travel scheme for women

title: Opposition hits out at Oil Ministry’s poster featuring Savarkar and Gandhi
content: Congress general secretary (organisation) K.C. Venugopal says the poster elevated Savarkar over the Father of the Nation in an attempt to ‘distort’ history and make heroes out of ‘traitors’

title: Nagaland Governor and former BJP leader L. Ganesan passes away at 80
content: He had earlier served as the Governor of Manipur and held the additional charge as the Governor of West Bengal

title: Every citizen has a duty to safeguard freedom: Minister R. Bindu
content: At the 79th Independence Day celebrations, Minister underscores need to uphold democratic ideals rooted in inclusion and the integration of marginalised communities into the mainstream

title: Girl child’s death: police to probe suspected negligence in medical care
content: The child’s parents allege that her condition deteriorated because the hospital authorities did not provide timely medical care during the crucial golden hour

title: Sanction accorded to set up four regional sanitary waste incineration facilities
content: The plants are proposed at Kottarakara, Muvattupuzha, Kuttippuram, and Kadannappalli. Earlier this week, a sanitary waste processing plant had opened in Varkala municipality in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Govt. embarks upon swapping high interest loans with low interest ones
content: Raises market borrowings of low interests to repay high interest loans of SPVs like Kaleshwaram project

title: BJP, TDP leaders stress unity, recall Muslim role in freedom struggle
content: At Independence Day events in Vijayawada, they highlight sacrifices across communities, denounce communal divisions, and honour Ashfaqulla Khan, Ram Prasad Bismil, and other icons of the freedom movement

title: Fight collectively against attempts to hamper India’s diversity: Riyas
content: The Minister calls for every citizen to adopt a no-compromise attitude towards those trying to distort historical facts and stresses the need to safeguard the country’s secular character and democratic values

title: Construction of bridge connecting Kottayam and Alappuzha sees steady progress
content: Though the construction of the bridge got under way in 2016 with an 18-month completion period, the work came to a halt midway due to  delay in acquiring land for the construction of approach roads on both sides

title: Andhra Pradesh leaders call for inclusive growth, stronger democracy on 79th I-Day celebrations
content: From the Assembly to the Secretariat, they urge responsible governance, social equity, and grassroots development while paying homage to freedom fighters

title: Cultural shows by students enthral public during I-Day celebrations at Railway Stadium
content: Vijayawada Division won 12 best performance shields, including the overall efficiency shield, says DRM Mohit Sonakiya

title: Flood level at Prakasam Barrage likely to rise in next 48 hours; NDRF, SDRF teams positioned in vulnerable areas
content: Alert sounded for many mandals in Krishna and NTR districts as IMD and Central Water Commission predict heavy rainfall in the upstream areas of the Krishna on August 17, say officials

title: Independence Day celebrated with great fervour in Hubballi Dharwad
content: The tricolour was seen fluttering atop various offices and houses and in balconies of residential complexes across the twin cities

title: Judiciary a strong pillar of democracy, says Andhra Pradesh High Court Chief Justice
content: At the 79th Independence Day celebrations, Justice Dhiraj Singh Thakur calls on the legal fraternity to uphold public trust and rededicate themselves to the nation’s service

title: Andhra Pradesh committed to poverty eradication and 24x7 quality power: Minister
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar outlines key welfare initiatives, infrastructure upgrades, and clean energy goals at 79th Independence Day celebrations in Bapatla

title: Upgraded 112 emergency support system formally launched
content: The next-generation Emergency Response Support System (ERSS) aims at enhancing service accessibility and ensure faster response times through the integration of advanced technologies.

title: Marksheet scam in Gulbarga University: loss pegged at ₹11.67 crore
content: As per the rules of NEP, instead of physical marksheets, it is mandatory to issue digital marksheets to students who have completed their degrees. But the varsity has violated the govt. order and printed marksheets

title: 175 MSME Parks will be developed in A.P. as part of ‘Vision 2047’, says Minister
content: Kondapalli Srinivas urges the people to understand government’s concept “One family-One entrepreneur” and take advantage of the schemes launched for quick industrial growth of the State

title: Various events mark 79th Independence Day in Alappuzha
content: Fisheries Minister hoists national flag at Alappuzha Recreation ground. He urges people to remain vigilant against divisive forces

title: Michael Phelps offers swim lessons at Ravens training camp
content: the most decorated Olympian of all time delivered on his promise to the Baltimore Ravens . the visit came two weeks after cornerback marlon Humphrey posted a video on social media . he taught some players how to swim in and out of the pool .

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC 319 and PFL championships
content: the title fight will take place at the UFC 319 on august 19 at 10 p.m. ET . the MMA championships continue from Charlotte, North Carolina, on friday . du Plessis is a perfect 9-0 with six early stoppages and Chimaev 8-0 .

title: Three picks to make on your favorite team
content: the NFL season offers an almost unlimited amount of betting opportunities, from seasonlong win totals to individual player props . some picks look at the big picture, such as Super Bowl futures or division odds . if you're a futures-focused bettor mapping out the entire season, consider it your all-in-one starting point for betting the 2025 season .

title: Rays seek offensive boost; Padres' King on IL
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the news cycle will constantly affect player values in fantasy baseball . he's hit .263/.327/.553 in the minors, though his 25.7% strikeout rater is expected to be in the lineup .

title: "Not Here To Negotiate For Ukraine": Trump Aboard Flight To Meet Putin
content: "HIGH STAKES!" That's what US President Donald Trump posted on his social media company Truth Social ahead of the flight to Alaska where he is scheduled to meet his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin, in an event being billed as historic.

title: 6 Killed After Roof At Dargah Near Delhi's Humayun's Tomb Collapses
content: Six people were killed after part of the roof of a dargah, or the tomb of a Muslim saint, collapsed in Delhi's Nizamuddin area Friday evening.

title: Nagaland Governor La Ganesan Dies At 80, PM Modi Calls Him "Devout Nationalist"
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday expressed grief over the death of Tamil Nadu Governor La. Ganesan who passed away in Chennai at the age of 80.

title: Thackeray Cousins To Contest Mumbai, Other Civic Polls Together: Sanjay Raut
content: The upcoming civic polls in Mumbai and key cities may see cousins Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray, earlier not on amicable terms, form an alliance, said Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut.

title: Centre Proposes Reducing GST Slabs From 4 To 2, May Retain 5%, 18%: Sources
content: The Centre has proposed that only two slabs for Goods and Services Tax (GST) be retained - 5 per cent and 18 percent - as per sources.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Top Court's Stray Dogs Order Can Cost A Fortune. But That's Not The Point
content: Housing Delhi's 10 lakh dogs would require at least Rs 10,000 crore in construction alone, more than half of Delhi's entire Rs 17,224 crore capital outlay for all development in 2025-26.

title: Nagaland Governor La Ganesan Dies At 80
content: Nagaland Governor La Ganesan died on Friday while undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Chennai, a Raj Bhavan official said.

title: "Counting On America To End War", Says Zelensky Ahead Of Trump-Putin Meet
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Friday urged Donald Trump to convince Russia to halt its invasion at the US leader's high-stakes summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska.

title: Actor Shwetha Menon Becomes 1st Woman To Be Elected Head Of Kerala Film Body AMMA
content: In a landmark moment for the Malayalam film industry, popular actresses Shwetha Menon and Kukku Parameswaran have been elected as president and general secretary, respectively, of the Association of Malayalam Movie Artists (AMMA).

title: "Greed": Aaditya Thackeray Slams BCCI over India-Pak Asia Cup Matches
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray on Friday targeted the BCCI over India Pakistan cricket matches in the Asia Cup.

title: 10 Pilgrims Dead, 35 injured As Bus Rams Truck Parked On Roadside In West Bengal
content: Ten pilgrims from Bihar died and 35 others were injured as their bus rammed into a truck parked on the roadside in West Bengal's Burdwan town on Friday, officials said.

title: AIMIM Leader Hosts 'Biryani Party' To Oppose Meat Ban In Maharashtra District
content: AIMIM leader Imtiaz Jaleel on Friday organised a "biryani party" at his residence here to mark his protest against the local civic body's order to keep the meat shops in the city shut on account of festivals.

title: From Putin To Netanyahu: Global leaders Wish India On Independence Day
content: Global leaders and neighbours extended greetings to India on the 79th Independence Day on Friday while reaffirming strong bilateral ties with the country.

title: How India's Choice Of August 15 As Independence Day Has A Japan Link
content: Amid rising communal violence and worsening law and order, the British Parliament decided that the colonial rule in India would end on August 15, 1947.

title: Chandrababu Naidu Launches Statewide Free Bus Travel Scheme For Women
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Friday launched 'Stree Shakti', a statewide free bus travel scheme for women, in the presence of NDA leaders here.

title: 60 Killed, 500 Feared Trapped After Cloudburst In J&K's Kishtwar
content: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference Chief Farooq Abdullah believes over 500 people continue to be trapped.

title: Jammu And Kashmir Cloudburst Highlights: Rescue Ops On As 46 Killed In Kishtwar, Chief Minister Cancels Independence Day Cultural Events
content: At least 46 people died, including two Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel, after a massive cloudburst struck Chashoti village in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Thursday.

title: Boy Killed, Many Injured In Cylinder Blast In Bengaluru, 6 Houses Damaged
content: A 10-year-old boy died while nine others were injured in a cylinder blast in central Bengaluru's Wilson Garden this morning.

title: Trump-Putin Alaska Meet: Hotels, Cabs Booked Out, Temporary Curbs On Flights
content: US President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, are scheduled to meet on Friday in Alaska in a high-stakes and high-risk summit that could prove decisive for the future of Ukraine.

title: This Whale Species Was Smaller Than A Bed. Fossil Found On Australia Beach
content: A chance discovery of a 25 million-year-old fossil on an Australian beach has allowed paleontologists to identify a rare, entirely new species that could unlock mysteries of whale evolution.

title: Augusta National ditches the masses in a quest for higher revenues
content: the 2026 "Official Masters Hospitality" program includes offers of housing, transportation, catering and so on to the corporate and/or well-heeled . the "Full Scale, Private Home Program," which will run you a mere $219,600 for the week, comes days after the announcement that a local Hooters restaurant is closing .

title: From nobody to a star: South Carolina QB LaNorris Sellers is making a name for himself
content: laNorris Sellers and DJ lagway are two quarterbacks to keep an eye on during the college football season . Sellers took the gamecocks to the brink of the College Football Playoff . the QB is taking selfies and signing autographs everywhere he goes .

title: Will the NBA offseason frenzy return? 10 storylines we're watching for 2026
content: Chinay Ogwumike says the Hawks could lose star playmaker Trae Young as he enters the final year of his contract . the 2026 draft includes the futures of superstars leBron James , Giannis Antetokounmpo , Nikola Jokic and Stephen Curry . here are the top 10 questions that could define the summer of 2026 .

title: 'It's just not worth it': Why the Dodgers won't rush Ohtani -- no matter their record
content: Shohei Ohtani is the first 50/50 player in baseball history . he has attempted five steals in 12 games in august . it's a small part of a bigger conflict between what he can do and what the Dodgers believe .

title: 'Historic relationship': US says ties with India good - despite Trump's tariff tantrums
content: Rajghatta is author of Kamala Harris: Phenomenal Woman Janhvi Kapoor’s mesmerising saree game is giving sleepless nights to other actresses!
